page.title: 14RECOLLECTIONS OF STAMBOURNE
page.content: {Written by an older resident who has {lived at Moat Hall Farm for 30 years.} This end of the village of Stambourne has not altered much in the last 30 years, as it is called the Green Belt. And no houses are allowed to be built here. Only farm buildings etc. It is the Cornish Hall end road. There is a chase up to a very old house called Slough Farm. Then there is Moat Hall Farm, about 150 years old. Also Green Farm with an old thatched roof. Opposite this is a big field, once the Common belonging to the village, but now ploughed up and used for growing corn, etc. It now belongs to Revels Farm which is a little further up. This used to be called Lower Green Farm. Higher up there is Rockalls Farm. This was called Upper Green Farm and pigs were kept. (contd on p15)
